info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 4 at 4:25PM MDT until June 4 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
FFWABQ
The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Valencia County in central New Mexico...
* Until 630 PM MDT.
* At 425 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 0.75 inches of rain have fallen in the past 30 minutes. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Belen, Jarales, Casa Colorada, Los Trujillos-Gabaldon and Rio Communities.
This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 185 and 193.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of normally dry arroyos and streambeds, low water crossings, intersections and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low lying areas.
